Key Match Events: Nikola Jokic scored 18 of his 27 points in the third quarter
The Nuggets went ahead by 17 on Strawther’s 3-pointer with 1:04 left in the first quarter
Utah cut the deficit to 11 heading into the second and then used a 16-3 run to tie the score at 42 with 7:45 left in the half
Denver reeled off 14 straight points and settled for a 65-56 halftime lead
Jokic hit a hook shot, a 14-foot jumper and a trio of 3-pointers to give Denver a 24-point lead heading into the fourth
Jokic was 3-for-4 from behind the arc in the period to give Denver a 99-75 lead with a quarter left
Pre-Game Insights: Nikola Jokic added 16 rebounds and nine assists to finish just shy of a triple-double for the second straight night
Denver guard Jamal Murray is in concussion protocol after taking a blow to his head in the Nuggets’ loss Friday
Russell Westbrook got his first start of the season in place of Murray
Utah was missing Lauri Markkanen (back) and Jordan Clarkson (heel) and started rookies Cody Williams and Kyle Filipowski
Post-Match Reflections: Michael Porter Jr. scored 20 points, Julian Strawther had a season-high 19 points, Christian Braun scored 17, and Aaron Gordon had 12 points for the Nuggets
Both teams were playing without key players
The Jazz had six players score in double figures, led by Walker Kessler’s 18 points
